column3: Concept ACK. The same idea was in my TODO list.

Concept ACK!

-----

Wondering if it would be better to place the context documentation in the file rather than in the git message. Locating git messages/PRs can become difficult if a line gets changed often and moved around.

> Wondering if it would be better to place the context documentation in the file rather than in the git message.\n\nI've updated this to add some documentation inline. Let me know if it is explanatory enough.

From Autoconf [manual](https://www.gnu.org/savannah-checkouts/gnu/autoconf/manual/autoconf-2.69/autoconf.html#Specifying-Target-Triplets):
>  It defaults to the result of running `config.guess`.

In our code https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/e0bc27a14ceb18bfe3dd9ebdae6bef447c4ec922/depends/Makefile#L69

Could this cause any subtle problems?
